series.series.name: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: NEW YORK UP CLOSE

abstract.p: Guernsey's will auction off thousands of items from New York City big-top circuses, including carved carousel horses; photos (M)

block.p: As a mecca for big-top circuses and a center for carving carousel horses, New York played a major role in the history of public amusements. So it is fitting that on Friday and Saturday Guernsey's will auction off thousands of items recalling those shows. Among the items on the block at Pier 92 are, left, an example of craftsmanship from the Brooklyn studio of Charles Carmel, restored with glass gems and horse-hair tail, and, above, a horse by Stein & Goldstein of Coney Island. Posters for old circuses will also be sold, including, at right, an image of Chinese acrobats enjoying rice and tea while spinning from their braids.
